target.name: usage
target.echo:
This tool extracts assertion IDs out of text based specifications. The assumed format of the specifications is PDF. See the README for more details.
Defined Targets: usage : Prints this message. Default target. clean : Removes previously built classes. build : alias -> calls compile. compile: Builds the tool. run : Runs the tool on the specified input. Depends on compile. Definable Properties: prefix (optional): The string prepended to the regular expression that matches any numeric value in the PDF spec. If omitted, the empty string is used. Valid assertion ID examples: [JSP12345] prefix is JSP [WebSockets4] prefix is WebSockets [JSTL0000123] prefix is JSTL [WSC-1234] prefix is WSC [WSC 1234] prefix is WSC infile: The PDF to search for assertion IDs. outfile (optional): The resulting XML ouput file containing the found assertions. If omitted the output file is written to the base directory with the name extracted-ids.xml. output-prefix (optional): A string prepended to the assertion IDs found within the PDF specification. Defaults to "<specified-prefix>:SPEC:". legacy-format (optional): All the asserion IDs found in the spec pdf are passed through as they exist in the document with "-"s replaced with "."s in the numeric portion of the ID. This mode is not recommended. It should never be used unless there is a very specific and justifiable reason. Default value is false. Examples (if set to true): [WSC-1-2.3.4-5] -> WSC:SPEC:WSC-1.2.3.4.5 [WSC 1-2.3.4-5] -> WSC:SPEC:WSC-1.2.3.4.5 debug (optional): Defaults to false. When set to true produces an output message showing the raw assertion ID and the normed ID.
See the README for more details.
